intro: Pseudabutilon depauperatum, commonly known as the poor man's abutilon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
